meanings.definition: To land again after being in the air.
meanings.sent1: The plane will reland on the runway shortly.
meanings.sent2: After flying for hours, the pilot needed to reland the aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The bird forgot to reland on the branch and flew past it.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut had to reland on the moon's surface with precision.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon had to reland due to unexpected winds.

meanings.definition: To make land available for use or development.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to reland the area for new housing projects.
meanings.sent2: Developers aim to reland the waterfront for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent3: The farmer had to reland the field after the harvest.
meanings.sent4: The real estate company plans to reland the vacant lots for sale.
meanings.sent5: The community worked together to reland the park for public enjoyment.

meanings.definition: To connect or join together again.
meanings.sent1: The electrician had to reland the wires to restore power.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the crew needed to reland the broken bridge.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces didn't fit, so she had to reland them.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to reland the engine parts for the car to run smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter had to reland the pieces of wood to complete the table.
